item.title: Dozens of Teens Who Spent Time at Abusive Florida Reform School Ended Up on Death Row
item.description: Michael Bell, set to be executed Tuesday, is among at least 34 boys from the Dozier School later sentenced to death. Did abuse make them more violent?

item.title: How the “Big Beautiful Bill” Will Change Criminal Justice and Immigration
item.description: The new law aims to shift much of the nation’s law enforcement toward immigration — and could reduce efforts to prevent violent crime.

item.title: Shackled For Days and Weeks: A Federal Report Finds Widespread Abuse in Prisons
item.description: The report, by the Justice Department’s internal watchdog, comes after an investigative series by The Marshall Project and NPR exposed similar abuses.

item.title: How the Supreme Court Ruled Differently in Immigration and Criminal Justice Cases
item.description: In a term marked by rulings limiting immigrants’ rights, the court sided with several other people harmed by the criminal justice system.

item.title: What, to the American Incarcerated Person, Is Your Fourth of July?
item.description: In the spirit of Frederick Douglass’ historic speech, 20 currently and formerly incarcerated Americans explain what Independence Day means to them.
